climbs.name: Stairway to Heaven
climbs.fa: Randy McClure and Ben Chapman, December 1994

content.description: Follow the obvious undercling up and right then make a slight balance mantle onto a good ledge. Proceed up the right slanting hand crack to the top.
content.protection:
The crack takes gear, however you must run out the first half of the climb until after the mantle ledge.

You might want a spotter.
content.location: About 50 feet to the left of Green Crack around the corner from a boulder.

content.description: Easy crack to a ledge about 8ft up.  Then plug in and start jamming, the crack goes from hands to fists but the jams are solid the whole way up.
content.protection: Leave the small nuts at the bottom, all you'll need are some larger hexes and cams
content.location: Head south from the parking area and keep a look out on the left for the obvious crack.  about a 1/4 mile hike.

content.description:
To get to the start of this climb go up Green Crack or Big Bang.  From the top go left to the start of the climb.  Pretty easy slab/scramble curving to the right out of the belayer's sight up to a chimney which you go up to summit.

Because it traverses to the right I ran it out so there's no rope drag.  I used #.5 to #3 cam range to create an anchor at the top.
content.location: It starts at the end of Green Crack or Big Bang to the left.

content.description:
Twin cracks that finish in a good hand crack. Face holds are abundant throughout the first half of the climb. The crux is probably the 7 foot hand crack at the end. Fun and easy climb, very enjoyable!

Easy walk off.
content.location: The left of the two obvious cracks.

climbs.name: Big Bang
climbs.fa: Randy McClure and Ben Chapman, December 1994

content.description: Wide crack with good jams. Start up a flake slightly to the left of the crack
content.protection: Standard rack, maybe on the larger side.
content.location: The right of the two obvious cracks.
